pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.1: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.2: an association had prepared a meal together with robes for the Sangha. They said,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.3: “After giving the food, we’ll offer the robes.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.4: But the monks from the group of six went to that association
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.6: “Please give these robes to these monks.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.8: We’ve prepared our annual alms-offering together with robes for the Sangha.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.9: “The Sangha has many donors and supporters.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.10: But since these monks are staying here, they are looking to you for support.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.11: If you don’t give to them, who will?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.13: Being pressured by the monks from the group of six, that association gave the prepared robes to those monks and served the food to the Sangha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.14: The monks who knew that a meal together with robes had been prepared for the Sangha, but not that the robes had been given to those monks from the group six, said,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.17: The robes we had prepared were diverted by the monks from the group of six.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.18: The monks of few desires complained and criticized those monks,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.19: “How could the monks from the group of six divert to an individual things they knew were intended for the Sangha?” …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.20: “Is it true, monks, that you did this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.23: “… Foolish men, how could you do this?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.24: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.25: And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.26.1: ‘If a monk diverts to an individual material support that he knows was intended for the Sangha, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:2.1.4: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:2.1.6: he knows by himself or others have told him or the donor has told him.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:2.1.8: given to the Sangha, given up to the Sangha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:2.1.10: robes, almsfood, a dwelling, and medicine; even a bit of bath powder, a toothbrush, or a piece of string.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:2.1.12: if they have said, “We’ll give,” “We’ll prepare,” and he diverts it to an individual, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:2.2.1: If it is intended for the Sangha and he perceives it as such, and he diverts it to an individual, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:2.2.2: If it is intended for the Sangha, but he is unsure of it, and he diverts it to an individual, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:2.2.3: If it is intended for the Sangha, but he does not perceives it as such, and he diverts it to an individual, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:2.2.4: If it is intended for one Sangha and he diverts it to another Sangha or to a shrine, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:2.2.5: If it is intended for one shrine and he diverts it to another shrine or to a sangha or to an individual, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:2.2.6: If it is intended for an individual and he diverts it to another individual or to a sangha or to a shrine, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:2.2.7: If it is not intended for the Sangha, but he perceives it as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:2.2.8: If it is not intended for the Sangha, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:2.2.9: If it is not intended for the Sangha and he does not perceive it as such, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:2.3.3: “Where may we give?” he says, “Give where your gift goes toward equipment,” “… where it goes toward repairs,” “… where it will last for a long time,” “… where you feel inspired;”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:2.3.5: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:2.3.6: The twelfth rule, the training rule on diverting, is finished.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:2.3.7: The eighth sub-chapter on legitimately is finished.
